item.title: Forgive Every One Their Trespasses: The Parable of the Unmerciful Servant
item.description: The parable of the unmerciful servant to help students understand the doctrine taught in Doctrine and Covenants 64:2-13.

item.title: Jesus Was Astonished
item.description: (Mark 14:32–36) Elder Maxwell tells how Jesus Christ was astonished at the physical reality of the Atonement. An excerpt from “Willing to Submit,” Ensign, May 1985.

item.title: Peter Walking on Water
item.description: (Matthew 14:27–31) An excerpt from “The Beacon in the Harbor of Peace,” Ensign, Nov. 1992, 19.

item.title: Resurrection: The Ultimate Triumph
item.description: (Mark 16:1–7) President Howard W. Hunter eloquently addresses the miracle of the Resurrection. An excerpt from “An Apostle’s Witness of the Resurrection,” Ensign, May 1986.

item.title: None Were with Him
item.description: (Mark 15:34) Elder Jeffery R. Holland elaborates on the necessity for Heavenly Father to remove His presence from the Savior briefly, so Jesus could know what it feels like to sin. An excerpt from “None Were with Him,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2009.

item.title: If Thy Hand Offend Thee
item.description: (Mark 9:42–48) Elder Gonzalez teaches about leaving behind bad influences. An excerpt from “Today Is the Time,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2007.

item.title: Five Loaves and Two Fishes
item.description: (Mark 6:32–44) President James E. Faust shares how the humble, everyday actions of typical members of the Church is equal to the miracle of the loaves and fishes. An excerpt from “Five Loaves and Two Fishes,” Ensign, May 1994.

item.title: Healing the Sick
item.description: (Mark 6:5, 13; 7:32) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks of the principle of anointings for Priesthood blessings. An excerpt from “Healing the Sick,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2010.

item.title: Keep the Sabbath Holy
item.description: (Mark 2:27–28) President Faust about the importance of Keeping the Sabbath Day Holy. An excerpt from “The Lord’s Day,” Ensign, Nov. 1991.

item.title: Lift Where You Stand
item.description: (Mark 2:2–5) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches about personal responsibility by sharing an experience in moving a piano. An excerpt from “Lift Where You Stand,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2008.

item.title: Washed Clean—Repentance
item.description: (Mark 1:40–45) President Boyd K. Packer shares a poem on repentance. An excerpt from “Washed Clean,” Ensign, May 1997, 10–11.

item.title: “He Is Not Here: for He Is Risen”
item.description: (Matthew 28:6) President Hinckley speaks about the Resurrection from the Tomb of Joseph of Arimathea. An excerpt from "Special Witnesses of Christ,” Ensign, Apr. 2001.

item.title: Because He Died, All Shall Live Again
item.description: (Matthew 27:52–53) An excerpt "I Know That My Redeemer Lives!” An answer to Job's question about life after death. Job 14:14 Ensign or Liahona, May 2007, 25.

item.title: The Savior’s Sufferings in Gethsemane
item.description: (Matthew 26:37–39) An excerpt from “He Lives! All Glory to His Name!” Ensign or Liahona, May 2010, 76–77.

item.title: The Emblems of the Sacrament
item.description: (Matthew 26:26–28) An excerpt from “This Do in Remembrance of Me,” Ensign, Nov. 1995, 67.

item.title: Hypocrisy
item.description: (Matthew 23:23–28) An excerpt from “What Manner of Men and Women Ought Ye to Be?” Ensign or Liahona, May 2011.

item.title: The Two Great Commandments
item.description: (Matthew 22:35–40) An excerpt from “The Great Commandment—Love the Lord,” Ensign, May 1988.

item.title: Convenience Versus Covenants
item.description: (Matthew 19:27–29) An excerpt from “Like a Flame Unquenchable,” Ensign, May 1999, 86.

item.title: Forgiveness Will Change Bitterness to Love
item.description: (Matthew 18:33) An excerpt from "Forgiveness Will Change Bitterness to Love,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2003, 12.

item.title: Statue of Peter Holding Keys
item.description: (Matthew 16:19) An excerpt from “The Shield of Faith,” Ensign, May 1995, 8.

item.title: A Personal Testimony of Jesus Christ
item.description: (Matthew 16:17–18) An excerpt from “The Power of a Personal Testimony,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2006, 38.

item.title: The Challenge to Become/Conversion
item.description: (Matthew 15:8) An excerpt from “The Challenge to Become,” Ensign, Nov. 2000, 32–33.

item.title: The Lord’s Yoke
item.description: (Matthew 11:28–30) An excerpt from “Come unto Me,” Ensign, Nov. 1990, 18.

item.title: He That Loveth Father or Mother More Than Me
item.description: (Matthew 10:34–37)An excerpt from “The Great Commandment—Love the Lord,” Ensign, May 1988, 5.

item.title: Member Missionary Story
item.description: (Matthew 9:37–38) An excerpt from “The Essential Role of Member Missionary Work,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2003, 38–39.

item.title: Judge Not
item.description: (Matthew 7:1–5) A excerpt from “Charity Never Faileth,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2010, 122.

item.title: The Healing Power of Forgiveness
item.description: (Matthew 5:43) An excerpt from “The Healing Power of Forgiveness,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2007, 68.

item.title: Salt Losing Its Savor
item.description: (Matthew 5:13) An excerpt from “Salt of the Earth: Savor of Men and Saviors of Men,” Ensign, May 1980, 42–43.

item.title: Jesus Christ’s Temptations in the Wilderness
item.description: (Matthew 4:2–10) An excerpt from “Welcome Home,” Ensign, May 1999, 80.

item.title: Doctrine of the Godhead
item.description: (Matthew 3:13–17) Elder Jeffery R. Holland addresses the nature of the Godhead. An excerpt from “The Only True God and Jesus Christ Whom He Hath Sent,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2007, 41.

item.title: Prepare Today for the Second Coming
item.description: (Joseph Smith—Matthew 1:46–54; Matthew 24:42–51) An excerpt from “Preparation for the Second Coming,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2004, 8–9.

item.title: Beware of False Prophets and False Teachers
item.description: (Joseph Smith—Matthew 1:5–6, 9, 22; Matthew 24:4–5, 11, 24) An excerpt from “Beware of False Prophets and False Teachers,” Ensign, Nov. 1999, 62.

item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Synagogue Worship
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Shepherd
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Synagogue
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Leprosy
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: The Anointed One
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Sackcloth
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Purse and Scrip
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Living Christ
item.description: (Mark 16:1-11) Elder Dallin H. Oaks testifies of the Savior of the world.

item.title: Time
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Gethsemane
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Gift Of Faith
item.description: (Mark 11:20-24) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf speaks about the gift of faith.

item.title: Reverence Invites Revelation
item.description: (Mark 11:15-18) President Boyd K. Packer teaches of the importance of reverence in receiving revelation.

item.title: Filthiness
item.description: (Mark 7:1-23) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about how our brains record filthiness.

item.title: We Must Believe
item.description: (Mark 5:22-42) President James E. Faust declares that we must believe in God and rid ourselves of fear. ("Pioneers of the Future: 'Be Not Afraid, Only Believe'," Ensign, Nov. 1997)

item.title: Life's Storms
item.description: (Mark 4:35-41) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin speaks of enduring life's trials with the help of the Savior.

item.title: Keeping The Sabbath
item.description: (Mark 2:23-28) President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches the importance of keeping the Sabbath day holy.

item.title: Pray In Solitude
item.description: (Mark 1:35) Bishop H. Burke Peterson teaches how to sincerely and earnestly pray.

item.title: Miracles
item.description: (Mark 1:23; 2:12) President Harold B. Lee says the greatest miracles today are "the healing of sick souls."

item.title: Sacredness of the Sacrament
item.description: (Matthew 26:26-29) L. Tom Perry speaks about the sacredness of the Sacrament.

item.title: To This End Was I Born
item.description: (Matthew 26-28) This segment depicts the concluding hours of the Savior's mortal ministry.

item.title: Wedding Feasts
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Hypocrisy
item.description: (Matthew 23:2-28) Elder M. Eldon Tanner teaches of two kinds of hypocrisy.

item.title: Phylacteries
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Mercy
item.description: (Matthew 21) A doctrinal explanantion of how the Lord's justice and mercy affect us.

item.title: Justice
item.description: (Matthew 21) A doctrinal explanation of how the Lord's justice and mercy affect us.

item.title: Keys Restored
item.description: (Matthew 16:17-19) Elder Robert D. Hales shares an experience of President Spencer W. Kimball when he testified of living prophets and apostles.

item.title: Beware Of False Doctrine
item.description: (Matthew 16:5-12) Elder M. Russell Ballard teaches all to actively avoid sin.

item.title: Peter Walks On Water
item.description: (Matthew 14:24-33) President Howard W. Hunter speaks of the importance of keeping our sights on the Savior. ("The Beacon in the Harbor of Peace," Ensign, Nov. 1992)

item.title: The Sower
item.description: (Matthew 13) A miniature New Testament character teaches a young man how to understand parables.

item.title: Creatures revealed
item.description: (Matthew 13) Revealing camouflaged creatures.

item.title: Camouflaged creatures
item.description: (Matthew 13) Clips of camouflaged creatures.

item.title: Lifts Our Burdens
item.description: (Matthew 11:28-30) Dallin H. Oaks speaks about how Christ lifts our burdens.

item.title: Power to Raise The Dead
item.description: (Matthew 10:1-15) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland shares a story of a newly ordained elder giving a priesthood blessing to a young boy who had been struck by lightening.

item.title: A Test of Faith
item.description: (Matthew 9) The members of a family in trouble discover the Savior's power to heal physically and spiritually. Segment 2 - A test of faith.

item.title: Challenges
item.description: (Matthew 9) The members of a family in trouble discover the Savior's power to heal physically and spiritually. Segment 1 - Challenges.

item.title: Fan
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Come unto Me
item.description: Student interviews and experiences from the life of the Savior emphasize why we should come unto Him.

item.title: Pharisees, Sadducees, and Scribes
item.description: A television news magazines helps us understand the religious and political climate at the time of Christ. Segment 2 - Pharisees, Sadducees, and scribes; the law; and travel throughout the Roman Empire

item.title: News program
item.description: A television news magazines helps us understand the religious and political climate at the time of Christ. Segment 1 - News program.

item.title: The Maze
item.description: A teenage competition through a maze is used as an analogy to show how the scriptures help us get through life.

item.title: Importance of the New Testament
item.description: Importance of the New Testament.

item.title: “Lovest Thou Me More Than These?”
item.description: (John 21:15) An excerpt from "The First Great Commandment,” Ensign, Nov. 2012.

item.title: Believing in the Witness of Others
item.description: (John 20:29–31) An excerpt from “This Glorious Easter Morn",Ensign, May 1996

item.title: Jesus Christ’s Love
item.description: (John 17:26) An excerpt from “The Power of God’s Love,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2004.

item.title: Being One with God and Christ
item.description: (John 17:11, 20–23) By submitting to the Father, Jesus Christ achieved perfect unity. An excerpt from “That They May Be One in Us,” Ensign, Nov. 2002.

item.title: Simon Peter Denied the Savior Three Times
item.description: (John 18:15–18, 25–27) President Gordon B. Hinckley shares his compassion for the Apostle Peter. An excerpt from “And Peter Went Out and Wept Bitterly,” Ensign, Mar. 1995.

item.title: The Source of Our Joy
item.description: (John 16:20–22) In the final hours of the Savior's life, he taught his disciples about the joy that was to come. An excerpt from “Rejoice!” Ensign, Nov. 1996.

item.title: Christian Courage
item.description: (John 15:18–21) If we are to have Christian Courage, we need to respond as the Savior did. An excerpt from “Christian Courage: The Price of Discipleship,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2008.

item.title: Abide in Me
item.description: (John 15:4–5) An excerpt from “Abide in Me,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2004.

item.title: “Peace I Leave with You”
item.description: (John 14:27; 16:33) An excerpt from “Master, the Tempest Is Raging,” Ensign, Nov. 1984.

item.title: “He That Hath Seen Me Hath Seen the Father”
item.description: (John 14:7–11; 16:25) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland teaches that Jesus Christ came to plead with man to love their Heavenly Father. Excerpt from “The Grandeur of God,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2003.

item.title: Disciples Are Distinguished by Love
item.description: (John 13:34–35) Elder Wirthlin states that love is the defining quality to should define members of the Church. An excerpt from “The Great Commandment,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2007.

item.title: “I Am the Resurrection, and the Life”
item.description: (John 11:25–26) President Thomas S. Monson speaks about receiving reassurance about death being temporary. An excerpt from “Now Is the Time,” Ensign, Nov. 2001.

item.title: Other Sheep
item.description: (John 10:16) An excerpt from “All Men Everywhere,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2006.

item.title: The Good Shepherd
item.description: (John 10:1–18) An excerpt from “A Call to the Priesthood: ‘Feed My Sheep,’” Ensign, May 1983.

item.title: Addictions Surrender Our Freedoms of Choice
item.description: (John 8:33–34) An excerpt from “Addiction or Freedom,” Ensign, Nov. 1988.

item.title: Spiritual Anorexia
item.description: (John 6:26–27) An excerpt from “He Hath Filled the Hungry with Good Things,” Ensign, Nov. 1997.

item.title: The Scriptures Testify of Jesus Christ
item.description: (John 5:39–40) An excerpt from “The Miracle of the Holy Bible,” Ensign and Liahona, May 2007.

item.title: Jesus Christ Will Be Our Final Judge
item.description: (John 5:22, 27, 30) Elder Scott declares that the Atonement makes it possible for Jesus Christ to be our final judge. An excerpt from “The Atonement Can Secure Your Peace and Happiness,” Ensign and Liahona, Nov. 2006.

item.title: Faith of Our Fathers
item.description: (John 4:20–24) President Uchtdorf answers the question, "What is the Faith of our Father in Heaven?" An excerpt from “Faith of Our Father,” Ensign and Liahona, May 2008.

item.title: Living Water
item.description: (John 4:10–14) Elder Wirthlin states that in order for us to receive healing, we have to be obedient. An excerpt from “The Abundant Life,” Ensign and Liahona, May 2006.

item.title: “Born Again”
item.description: (John 3:3–5) An excerpt from “Born Again,” Ensign and Liahona, May 2008.

item.title: “Come, Follow Me”
item.description: (John 1:35–51) Elder Holland uses the invitation Jesus extended to Andrew and John to show the Lord's invitation to follow Him is still, and will always be extended. An excerpt from “He Hath Filled the Hungry with Good Things,” Ensign, Nov. 1997.

item.title: The Lamb of God
item.description: (John 1:29) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about the requirements of being the Lamb of God. An excerpt from “The Atonement,” Ensign, Nov. 1996

item.title: The Divine Sonship of Jesus Christ
item.description: (John 1:14) Elder Wells states that Jesus Christ is central to understanding the Plan of Salvation. An excerpt from “Our Message to the World,” Ensign, Nov. 1995.

item.title: How Jesus Christ Responded to His Accusers
item.description: (Luke 23:4–12) Elder Hales helps us to know how to respond as the Savior would. An excerpt from “Christian Courage: The Price of Discipleship,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2008.

item.title: To Be Converted
item.description: (Luke 22:32) Elder Oaks gives a commission to "act" upon the doctrines of the gospel. An excerpt from “The Challenge to Become,” Ensign, Nov. 2000.

item.title: “This Do in Remembrance of Me”
item.description: (Luke 22:19–20) Remembering the Savior in all things. An excerpt from “This Do in Remembrance of Me,” Ensign, Nov. 1995.

item.title: Continue in Patience
item.description: (Luke 21:19) How to gain perfection through self-mastery from patience. An excerpt from “Continue in Patience,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2010.

item.title: The Pharisee and the Publican
item.description: (Luke 18:9–14) An excerpt from “The Pharisee and the Publican,” Ensign, May 1984.

item.title: The Elder Prodigal Son
item.description: (Luke 15:25–32) Elder Holland illuminates another lesson of the Prodigal Son tale. An excerpt from “The Other Prodigal,” Ensign, May 2002.

item.title: Story of a Faithful Home Teacher
item.description: (Luke 15:4, 8) President Monson tells the story of Willard Milne and Dick Hammer. An excerpt from “Home Teaching—a Divine Service,” Ensign, Nov. 1997.

item.title: “Wherefore, Settle This in Your Hearts”
item.description: (Joseph Smith Translation, Luke 14:28) Young men and young women need to set priorities in life. An excerpt from “Wherefore, Settle This in Your Hearts,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2006.

item.title: “It’s True, Isn’t It? Then What Else Matters?”
item.description: (Luke 14:26–33)In an interview, a young Naval Officer states the gospel is true, so the consequences of membership do not matter. An excerpt from “It’s True, Isn’t It? Then What Else Matters?” Ensign or Liahona, May 2007.

item.title: Good, Better, Best
item.description: (Luke 10:38–42) Elder Oaks helps to discern the best choices in life. An excerpt from “Good, Better, Best,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2007.

item.title: Divine Forgiveness
item.description: (Luke 7:36–50) Elder Anderson tells of a mans needs to feel forgiven. An excerpt from “Repent . . . That I May Heal You,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2009.

item.title: The Meaning of Discipleship
item.description: (Luke 5:10–11) President Faust talks about what it means to be a true disciple of Jesus Christ. An excerpt from Discipleship,” Ensign or Liahona, Nov. 2006.

item.title: “And Was Subject unto Them”
item.description: (Luke 2:51) Elder Samuelson states the being "subject" to parents and leaders is a duty. An excerpt from “Our Duty to God,” Ensign, Nov. 2001.

item.title: A “Mother” Heart
item.description: (Luke 1:38) Sister Beck helps women understand what it means to develop a disposition to mother. An excerpt from “A ‘Mother Heart,’” Ensign or Liahona, May 2004.

item.title: Feed My Lambs
item.description: (John 21:1-6; 15-17) Elder Robert D. Hales shows how to feed the Savior's sheep.

item.title: School Bus
item.description: (John 21) Five short dramatizations explore the Savior's request to feed His sheep. Segment 5 - School bus.

item.title: Swearing
item.description: (John 21) Five short dramatizations explore the Savior's request to feed His sheep. Segment 4 - Swearing.

item.title: A Valued Gift
item.description: (John 21) Five short dramatizations explore the Savior's request to feed His sheep. Segment 3 - A valued gift.

item.title: Assigned a Friend?
item.description: (John 21) Five short dramatizations explore the Savior's request to feed His sheep. Segment 2 - Assigned a friend?

item.title: Track Meet on Sunday
item.description: (John 21) Five short dramatizations explore the Savior's request to feed His sheep. Segment 1 - Track meet on Sunday.

item.title: Except I Shall See
item.description: (John 20:24-29) Elder Robert D. Hales encourages all people to exercise their faith in Jesus Christ.

item.title: Wine Press
item.description: (John 20:1-23) President James E. Faust testifies of the Atonement of Jesus Christ. ("The Atonement: Our Greatest Hope," Ensign, Nov. 2001, 18-20.)

item.title: Testimony of the Savior's Suffering
item.description: (John 18:19) Elder Neal A. Maxwell testifies of the Savior's ability to understand our pain and suffering.

item.title: True Vine
item.description: (John 15:1-5) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland speaks about 'The True Vine'. ("Abide in Me," Ensign, May 2004).

item.title: Comfortless
item.description: (John 14:15-26) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about how God will not leave us comfortless.

item.title: I am the Resurrection and the Life
item.description: (John 11:25-26) President Thomas S. Monson testifies that the Atonement of Jesus Christ swallows up the darkness of death.

item.title: Good Shepherd
item.description: (John 10:1-28) Elder John R. Lasater shares an experience of a loving shepherd in Morocco caring for an injured sheep. ("Shepherds of Israel," Ensign, May 1988.)

item.title: Not all Suffering Results from Sin
item.description: (John 9:1-5) Elder Boyd K. Packer clarifies that disabilities and handicaps do not come because of sin.

item.title: Seed Of Abraham
item.description: (John 8:33-59) James E. Faust speaks about the Seed of Abraham.

item.title: Tolerance
item.description: (John 8:1-11) Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks of the vital virtue of tolerance. ("Teach Us Tolerance and Love," Ensign, May 1994)

item.title: Living Water
item.description: (John 4:1-14) Joseph B. Wirthlin talks about living water.

item.title: The Woman at the Well
item.description: (John 4) This presentation depicts the Savior teaching a Samaritan woman that He is the source of living water.

item.title: Born Again
item.description: (John 3:1-6) President James E. Faust speaks about how we must be born again.

item.title: Heavenly Things
item.description: (John 3:12) (John 3) This presentation depicts the Savior teaching a Nicodemus of "heavenly things".

item.title: Come And See
item.description: (John 1:39) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf invites people to learn of the gospel, and follow the Lord's invitation to come and see.

item.title: Finding The Lamb
item.description: (John 1:36-41) David B. Haight speaks about finding the Lamb of God.

item.title: Jesus was God The Creator
item.description: (John 1:1-3) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks of the beautiful creations of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Road to Emmaus
item.description: (Luke 24) This presentation depicts the Savior's appearance to two disciples on the road to Emmaus after His resurrection.

item.title: Strengthen Thy Brethren
item.description: (Luke 22:31-32) Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches that all must be first converted themselves before being able to fully strengthen others.

item.title: Sacrament montage
item.description: (Luke 22:1-20) A doctrinal explanation of how the Lord's justice and mercy affect us. Segment 3 - Sacrament montage.

item.title: Testimonies
item.description: (Luke 22:1-20) A doctrinal explanation of how the Lord's justice and mercy affect us. Segment 2 - Testimonies.

item.title: The Jar
item.description: (Luke 22:1-20) A doctrinal explanation of how the Lord's justice and mercy affect us. Segment 1 - The jar.

item.title: Taking the Lord's Blessings for Granted
item.description: (Luke 17:11-19) David B. Haight speaks about taking the Lord's blessings for granted.

item.title: Prodigal Son
item.description: (Luke 15:11-32) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about the Prodigal Son.

item.title: Price Of Discipleship
item.description: (Luke 14:25-33) President James E. Faust speaks about the price of discipleship.

item.title: Occupied With Routine
item.description: (Luke 10:38-42) Elder Dallin H. Oaks urges us to recognize spiritual opportunities.

item.title: Modern-day Good Samaritan
item.description: (Luke 10:25-37) President James E. Faust speakes about being a modern-day good Samaritan.

item.title: Good Samaritan
item.description: (Luke 10:25-37) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains the parable of the good Samaritan and what it means for us today.

item.title: Eternal Goals
item.description: (Luke 9:57-62) President Howard W. Hunter uses an analogy of a plowman to remind new members to never look back on past transgressions, except to measure growth.

item.title: Different Beliefs
item.description: (Luke 9:49-56) President Gordon B. Hinckley urges respect for all those with diverse beliefs and teachings.

item.title: Our Accounts
item.description: (Luke 7:36-50) President Boyd K. Packer testifies of the Savior's complete forgiveness if we fully repent.

item.title: Widow Of Nain
item.description: (Luke 7:11-16) President Thomas S. Monson asks all to help those in need as the Savior did. ("Never Alone," Ensign, May 1991, 59-61.)

item.title: Stand Firm
item.description: (Luke 4:1-13) President James E. Faust urges all to have courage and resist Satan.

item.title: Church Membership
item.description: (Luke 3:7-14) President Joseph Fielding Smith confirms that all must endure to the end.

item.title: Increased In Wisdom
item.description: (Luke 2:52) President Thomas S. Monson teaches us that we need divine guidance.

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: (Luke 2) This presentation depicts the account of Jesus's birth.

item.title: More Blessed to Give Than to Receive
item.description: President Monson tells a story from his youth that taught him it is better to give than receive.

item.title: Death Is Swallowed Up in Christ
item.description: President Uchtdorf testifies of the power of the Atonement and, if we will follow the Savior now, we will have less regrets tomorrow

item.title: God of Comfort
item.description: President Monson tells us that, even when the world is at its darkest, if we turn to the Lord; He will lift and guide us.

item.title: Youth and Family History
item.description: Elder Bednar counsels us to become more engaged in Family History work, so that we may become more involved in the Lord’s work by performing baptisms for the dead.

item.title: Foundation of Apostles and Prophets
item.description: Elder Holland tells us that Apostles and Prophets are meant to bless us all and form foundation stones of the true Church, and all of those are based upon the Redeemer.

item.title: Lively Hope of Resurrection
item.description: Elder Oaks expounds upon the vitality of the resurrection in the Father’s plan, and that because of it we may have hope for a better existence beyond out mortal lives.

item.title: Our bodies are our temples
item.description: Sister Tanner testifies that our bodies are temples, and should be treated as such.

item.title: Judging Others
item.description: Elder Ashton teaches that the Lord measures us by our hearts, not our worldly characteristics.

item.title: Shield of Faith Fashioned at Home
item.description: President Packer teaches that the Shield of Faith is forged in the family circle, and that all participate in its strength.

item.title: Abraham’s Seed
item.description: President Faust explains what it means to be Abraham’s seed, that as a part of that covenant we may also receive the promised blessings if we are faithful

item.title: Taking Pleasure in Infirmities
item.description: Elder Hales teaches that the Lord brings us close to Him by our trials, and that through these trials, we may be purified.

item.title: Pride
item.description: President Uchtdorf explains that pride is "a sin of comparison", and comes from a desire to be admired or envied.

item.title: Witnesses of the Resurrection
item.description: President Monson teaches us that we have our eyewitnesses to the truth of Christ, and that the testimony of prophets gives us assurance that He lives.

item.title: Compassion for Others
item.description: Bishop Edgley tells us that we are blessed to be a part of a church in which we ‘endure together’.

item.title: An High Priest of Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Holland testifies that, no matter how dark the world may seem, blessings will come for those that have embraced the Gospel of Jesus Christ

item.title: Hebrews 11:1
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar lays out the main elements and doctrines of faith.

item.title: The Future Is as Bright as Your Faith
item.description: President Monson testifies that, even during times when hope seems lost, so long as we have made the Gospel central to our lives and remain steadfast, we will be blessed beyond measure.

item.title: A Conscience Void of Offence
item.description: Elder Nelson asks us if we feel ready for an inspection of our lives by the Lord, and gives examples of men who did feel prepared to meet judgment.

item.title: Testimony of the Resurrection
item.description: President Monson bears his testimony on the actuality of the Father, Christ, and the Atonement.

item.title: Requirements of Salvation
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches that in our cleansing is dependent upon our faith, and goes on to say that those who have been baptized will be finally saved at the end of their lives if they have continued in their covenants.

item.title: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: Elder Cook advises members to become more active in sharing the Gospel with those around them. He tells us that if we do share with others, we will be blessed.

item.title: Selflessness
item.description: Elder Peterson describes the attributes of a truly selfless person and how they are willing to sacrifice for the benefit of others.

item.title: Feelings of Inadequacy
item.description: President Uchtdorf testifies that are things that God has given us to do, and that only we can do them.

item.title: Our Body Is Bought with a Price
item.description: Elder Christofferson tells us that is our duty to God to care for the bodies He has given us.

item.title: Account of Big Ed
item.description: Sister Dibb tells a story about a man whom her father had helped and assisted, and through the story testifies of friendship and loyalty.

item.title: A More Excellent Way
item.description: Elder Wirthlin tells us that without charity, we are missing the most important aspect of Christ—His love.

item.title: All Things Work Together for Good
item.description: Elder Martino tells of a lesson taught by the Apostle Paul to the Romans, and teaches us that our trials allow us to become more like the Savior

item.title: Share Gospel with Radiance
item.description: Elder Russel M. Nelson encourages us to be a bright example to those around us, and willing to share the gospel with warmth when called upon to do so.

item.title: Exceeding Great and Precious Promises
item.description: Elder Spencer J. Condie talks about the specific blessings that come from keeping the commandments of God.

item.title: The Trial of Your Faith
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen teaches us to surround ourselves in spiritual things to help us overcome a trial of faith.

item.title: Anointing the Sick
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches about the authority of the Melchizedek Priesthood.

item.title: The Tongue Is a Fire
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland warns us to be cautious of what we say, and to always use kidness and consideration in our words.

item.title: Light Dispels Darkness
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales tells us how we can repel the darkness of Satan with the light of Christ.

item.title: Potential to Become Like God
item.description: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin recounts a story when Elder James E. Talmage exemplified Christlike kindness.

item.title: Working out Our Salvation
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that even after all our efforts at obedience and faithfulness, we must still rely on the atonement and grace of Christ.

item.title: Receiving the Lord’s Name
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar tells us that it is through the ordinances of the gospel that we take upon us the name of Christ.

item.title: There Are Two Powers on the Earth
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley warns that a war between good and evil is being waged in this world, but that we should not fear because it is a fight we will win.

item.title: Patience
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf lays out the attributes and characteristic associated with patience.

item.title: Cast Not Away Therefore Your Confidence
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Hollands warns that the most difficult oppostition often comes when we are the most diligent and faithful.

item.title: Testimony of Jesus Is the Spirit of Prophecy
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches that our testimony of Jesus Christ and the gospel can only come through personal revelation.

item.title: Serving without Love
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that you can't be a true servant of Christ without love and selflessness.

item.title: Sacrificing for Christ’s Sake
item.description: President Spencer W. Kimball encourages us to sacrifice all that we have for the work of God.

item.title: Philosophies of Man Fall Short
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf says that while the world offers many explanations and answers, only the gospel ofJesus Christ contains the full and simple truth.

item.title: High Priest of Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Hollands encourages those struggling to not lose hope, that the gospel of Jesus Christ offers happiness and help in times of trouble.

item.title: Recognize when Spirit Leaves
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar encourages us to stay out of situations that would cause the spirit to withdraw itself.

item.title: The Great Apostasy
item.description: Elder Neal A. Maxwell explains the great apostasy.

item.title: Savior Knows Our Infirmities
item.description: Elder Merrill J. Bateman teaches that the atonement was a personal experience where Christ felt our suffering on an individual basis, thus allowing him to know exactly how to help us.

item.title: Jesus Christ Is in the Express Image of His Father
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland explains that Jesus being in the express image of His Father is a witness to both the ancient and modern world of what God the Father is like.

item.title: Spirit of Fear
item.description: President Thomas S Monson encourages us to face with courage the trials and difficulties of the future.

item.title: Qualifications for Bishops
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley lists the qualities and attributes of successful bishops.

item.title: Counsel Concerning Wealth
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales warns us to be frugal and careful with our money.

item.title: Purpose in Earthly Challenges
item.description: Elder Hales explains that, in order for us to become more like Christ, we must overcome the trials and tribulations in our lives.

item.title: Man from Ethiopia
item.description: Elder Holland teaches that for each of us to come unto Christ and follow Him and His commandments is a significant task is all our lives. But we must have sufficient instruction, and as such must seek guidance.

item.title: Revelation Follows Lines of Authority
item.description: Elder Perry explains that there is order to the Lord’s revelations, and so it is that one in a position of authority may receive revelation for those under him. Revelations from God are to come through the First Presidency.

item.title: Requirements for Unity
item.description: President Kimball instructs us to put aside selfish desires, cooperate with one another, and offer up a broken heart and contrite spirit.

item.title: How Apostles Are Called
item.description: President Hinckley states that modern-day Apostles are chosen by revelation from the Spirit, and do not put themselves forward.

item.title: Jerusalem Conference
item.description: Elder Christofferson teaches that the same pattern practiced by the Apostles of old has been restored, and that the First Presidency and Quorum of The Twelve receive revelation for the Church.

item.title: Charity
item.description: (1 Corinthians 13:1-13) Elder Dallin H. Oaks emphasizes the need for charity in order to obtain eternal life.

item.title: Church Callings
item.description: (1 Corinthians 12:19-23) President Gordon B. Hinckley emphasizes that all callings are important to the Lord.

item.title: Partake of Sacrament Worthily
item.description: (1 Corinthians 11:23-31) Elder John H. Groberg teaches of the personal way to discern one's worthiness for the sacrament. ("The Beauty and Importance of the Sacrament," Ensign, May 1989, 38.)

item.title: Man And Woman
item.description: (1 Corinthians 11:11) President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies that man and woman are God's design.

item.title: The Devil's Side of the Line
item.description: (1 Corinthians 10:13) President George Albert Smith teaches all to stay close to the Lord to find safety.

item.title: Ability To Bear
item.description: (1 Corinthians 10-13) President Boyd K. Packer urges us to resist the temptations of Satan.

item.title: Master The Flesh
item.description: (1 Corinthians 9:24-25) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains the importance of keeping covenants with God.

item.title: Flee Fornication
item.description: (1 Corinthians 6:9-11 and 18-20) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about how we should flee fornication.

item.title: Bodies Are Temples
item.description: (1 Corinthians 3:16-17) President Thomas S. Monson talks about how our bodies are temples of God.

item.title: Fed With Milk
item.description: (1 Corinthians 3:1-15) President Boyd K. Packer talks about how we are rewarded for the work we do.

item.title: Making Choices
item.description: (1 Corinthians 3-6) Keeping a home clean and beautiful serves as an analogy about keeping our lives worthy of the Spirit. Segment 2 - Making choices.

item.title: Room Transformation
item.description: (1 Corinthians 3-6) Keeping a home clean and beautiful serves as an analogy about keeping our lives worthy of the Spirit. Segment 1 - Room transformation.

item.title: Natural Man
item.description: (1 Corinthians 2:9-14) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin says that the natural man will not receive the things of the spirit.

item.title: Serving for the Right Reason
item.description: (Romans 16:18) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about serving for the right reason.

item.title: Love Your Neighbor
item.description: (Romans 14:10-12) Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks about loving our neighbors.

item.title: Foreordained
item.description: (Romans 9:9-14) President Harold B. Lee teaches of the blessings of our good decisions in the premortal life.

item.title: Nothing Can Separate
item.description: (Romans 8:38-39) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks about how we can never be separated from God's love.

item.title: Newness Of Life
item.description: (Romans 6:1-6) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about walking in the newness of life.

item.title: All Have Sinned
item.description: (Romans 3:10-12; 23-26) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about how everyone has sinned.

item.title: Natural Affection
item.description: (Romans 1:24-27) President Boyd K. Packer warns against Satan's influence in perverting the sacred powers of procreation.

item.title: Faith and Works
item.description: (Romans) An expedition to the North Pole serves as an analogy of how grace, faith, and works and necessary to gain eternal life.

item.title: Receiving Daily Assistance
item.description: (Romans) Three segments illustrate how the Lord's grace can help us gain salvation, overcome trials, and receive His daily assistance. Segment 3 - Receiving daily assistance.

item.title: Paralyzed Gymnast
item.description: (Romans) Three segments illustrate how the Lord's grace can help us gain salvation, overcome trials, and receive His daily assistance. Segment 2 - Paralyzed gymnast.

item.title: Parable of the Bicycle
item.description: (Romans) Three segments illustrate how the Lord's grace can help us gain salvation, overcome trials, and receive His daily assistance. Segment 1 - Parable of the bicycle.

item.title: Growing Through Life's Trials
item.description: (Acts 28:1-10) Elder Richard G. Scott discusses how to pass through life's trials willingly by trusting in the Lord. ("Finding Joy in Life," Ensign, May 1996, 24-26)

item.title: Prophets Warning
item.description: (Acts 27:9-44) Elder Spencer J. Condie uses a story of a broken bridge to tell of his gratitude for modern prophets who warn us of danger.

item.title: Valiant In Testimony
item.description: (Acts 24:10-21) Elder Dallin H. Oaks defines what it means to be valiant in the testimony of Jesus Christ. ("Witnesses of Christ," Ensign, Nov. 1990, 29.)

item.title: Others Beliefs
item.description: (Acts 21:16-26) Elder M. Russell Ballard reminds us to respect and love those who have different beliefs and values.

item.title: Paul: A Chosen Vessel
item.description: (Acts 21-28) This presentation depicts how the Lord molded and prepared Paul for his call to the ministry.

item.title: Spread Doubt
item.description: (Acts 20:29-30) President Gordon B. Hinckley invites all who have drifted from the Church to return.

item.title: Proclaim The Gospel
item.description: (Acts 16:9-15) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about how we are here to proclaim the gospel.

item.title: Culture Of Christ
item.description: (Acts 15:1-29) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about following the culture of Christ.

item.title: Respector of Persons
item.description: (Acts 10:34) Elder James M. Paramore shares a story of a Mormon American soldier administering to a wounded German soldier in World War II.

item.title: Long-Promised Day
item.description: (Acts 10) This presentation is a modern-day example of the Lord directing the Church through revelation to His prophet.

item.title: Godhead
item.description: (Acts 7:55-56) Elder Dallin H. Oaks testifies of the three separate beings of the Godhead.

item.title: Ananias And Sapphira
item.description: (Acts 5:1-11) Neal A. Maxwell speaks about lying.

item.title: The Lame Man
item.description: (Acts 3:2-8) President Gordon B. Hinckley counsels all to reach out to those who need help.

item.title: A New Apostle
item.description: (Acts 1:23-26) President Gordon B. Hinckley explains the process of choosing a new Apostle of the Lord.

item.title: Armour Of Light
item.description: (Romans 13:11-14) Elder Robert D. Hales talkes about putting on the Armour of Light and casting off the works of darkness.

item.title: Godly Sorrow Leads to Repentance
item.description: A young woman learns the difference between worldly sorrow and godly sorrow. 2 Corinthians 7

item.title: Lesson 1: The Message of the New Testament
item.description: Elder Thomas S. Monson speaks of the message of hope and joy in the New Testament.

item.title: Lesson 5: The Woman at the Well
item.description: Jesus teaches a Samaritan woman that He is the source of living water.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Anointed One
item.description: Jesus declares He is the promised Messiah to the people in the synagogue.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Purse and Scrip
item.description: A purse holds money, and a scrip is a travel bag.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Worship in the Synagogue
item.description: Congregation members in the synagogue participate in gospel instructions. Paul uses this to teach the gospel.

item.title: Lesson 8: New Testament Customs—Schoolmaster
item.description: The Law of Moses prepared people for the Savior's higher law.

item.title: Lesson 9: New Testament Customs—Phylacteries
item.description: Pharisees boast of their righteousness with larger phylacteries and longer garment fringes.

item.title: Lesson 10: Come Unto Me
item.description: A woman anoints Jesus's feet with oil. Jesus teaches the parable of the two debtors.

item.title: Lesson 16: New Testament Customs—The Synagogue
item.description: Those that were kicked out of the synagogue were considered excommunicated.

item.title: Lesson 16: New Testament Customs—Shepherd and Sheepfold
item.description: The sheep trust and follow only the voice of the shepherd.

item.title: Lesson 18: New Testament Customs—Leprosy
item.description: Leprosy was the most feared disease in the Holy Land.

item.title: Lesson 18: New Testament Customs—Time
item.description: In the ancient Middle East, time was divided differently than today's current measurements.

item.title: Lesson 20: New Testament Customs—Phylacteries
item.description: Pharisees boast of their righteousness with larger phylacteries and longer garment fringes.

item.title: Lesson 22: New Testament Customs—Marriage
item.description: Traditionally, the bridegroom journeys through town to meet his bride.

item.title: Lesson 23: New Testament Customs—Feasting
item.description: Feasting was done reclining on couches.

item.title: Lesson 25: New Testament Customs—Olive Press
item.description: Gethsemane means "oil press."

item.title: Lesson 31: The Second Coming
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer and Elder Neal A. Maxwell give counsel and caution regarding the Second Coming.

item.title: Lesson 38: Paul—A Chosen Vessel
item.description: This segment relates the life and mission of Paul.

item.title: Helps for Understanding the Book of Revelation Segment 1 - Archaeologists' Discovery
item.description: An archaeologist and two assistants discover symbols from the book of Revelation on the walls of an ancient room. Segment 1 - Archaeologists' discovery. Revelation

item.title: Helps for Understanding the Book of Revelation Segment 2 - Structure and Symbols
item.description: An archaeologist and two assistants discover symbols from the book of Revelation on the walls of an ancient room. Segment 2 - Structure and symbols. Revelation

item.title: Helps for Understanding the Book of Revelation Segment 3 - Main Theme
item.description: An archaeologist and two assistants discover symbols from the book of Revelation on the walls of an ancient room. Segment 3 - Main theme. Revelation

category.title: Bible Videos - The Life of Jesus Christ
category.subtitle: Videos: 98

item.title: The Armour of God
item.description: Saints should put on the whole armor of God. Ephesians 6:10-18

item.title: Repentance
item.description: Godly sorrow for sin leads to repentance. 2 Corinthians 7:8-10

item.title: Reconciled to God
item.description: The gospel reconciles man to God. Reference: 2 Corinthians 5:17-21

item.title: The Apostasy and Restoration
item.description: Paul forewarns of the apostasy that will precede the Second Coming of the Lord.

item.title: Resurrection of the Dead
item.description: Paul teaches of the Resurrection of the Dead. Reference: 1 Cor. 15: 20-26

item.title: Ye are the Temple of God
item.description: Paul teaches the Saints they are the temple of God.

item.title: Calming the Tempest
item.description: The disciples' faith is tested before Jesus calms the stormy sea.

item.title: Parable of the Sower
item.description: Jesus explains why he teaches with parables and gives the parable of the sower to a multitude gathered on the seashore.

item.title: Laborers in the Vineyard
item.description: Jesus gives the parable of the laborers in the Vineyard.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Wheat & Tares, Mustard Seed, and Leaven
item.description: Jesus uses parables to teach a crowd of people about the kingdom of heaven.

item.title: Lazarus is Raised from the Dead
item.description: Jesus testifies that He is the resurrection and the life. He raises Lazarus from the dead that His disciples may believe.

item.title: Feed My Sheep
item.description: Jesus shows Himself to His disciples and implores Peter to feed His sheep.

item.title: Wherefore Didst Thou Doubt?
item.description: Jesus walks on water, and bids Peter to come unto Him.

item.title: The Feeding of the 5000
item.description: Jesus provides a meal for 5000 people with only 5 loaves of bread and two fishes.

item.title: Christ's Authority is Questioned
item.description: Christ's authority is questioned by the chief priests and elders. He relates the parable of the two sons to them.

item.title: Widow Of Nain
item.description: Jesus raises the son of the widow of Nain from death.

item.title: I Have Kept the Faith
item.description: Paul endures to the end and gives a solemn charge to preach the gospel in a day of apostasy.

item.title: Charity Never Faileth
item.description: Charity, the pure love of Christ, exceeds almost all else.

item.title: Be of Good Cheer
item.description: Paul is comforted and told by the Lord that he must bear witness of Him in Rome.

item.title: Unity of the Faith
item.description: Paul writes of one Lord, one faith, one baptism and one Father. Christ appointed apostles, prophets, and teachers to help unify and perfect the saints.

item.title: Ye Are No More Strangers
item.description: Paul teaches that the atonement of Jesus Christ is available for all of God's children.

item.title: We Are the Offspring of God
item.description: Paul preaches to Athenians on Mars Hill and identifies their "unknown god" as the Father of us all. He testifies that we all are children of God.

item.title: The Jerusalem Conference
item.description: Peter and James speak to the Saints in Jerusalem to convince them that the Gentile converts are not subject to the requirements of the Law of Moses.

item.title: The Road to Damascus
item.description: Saul takes his journey to Damascus. While on the road, Jesus appears to Saul. He is blinded by the event. Ananias restores Saul’s sight. Saul is baptized.

item.title: The Martyrdom of Stephen
item.description: Stephen is taken before the Sanhedrin and falsely accused of blasphemy. His face shines like the face of an angel. He has a vision of the Father and the Son. He is martyred for his convictions as Saul watches.

item.title: Blessed Are They That Have Not Seen, and Yet Have Believed
item.description: Thomas, one of the twelve, doubts the appearance of the risen Lord. Christ appears, and tells him, “Blessed are those who have not seen, and yet have believed.”

item.title: The Risen Lord Appears to the Apostles
item.description: The resurrected Christ appears to the apostles and tells them “Peace be unto you!” They touch His hands and feet and He eats with them. He tells them He will send them as His father sent Him.

item.title: Christ Appears on the Road to Emmaus
item.description: The resurrected Christ walks with two men on the road to Emmaus. He blesses and breaks bread with them, and then vanishes from sight. Their hearts burned within them.

item.title: My Kingdom Is Not of This World
item.description: Jesus is persecuted, mocked and crucified. His followers mourn, and find the tomb empty on the third day. The Son of God breaks the bands of death and ascends to His Father in Heaven. -Easter Part 2

item.title: To This End Was I Born
item.description: Jesus Christ, the only begotten Son of God, and King of the Jews, was born to offer Himself as a sacrifice to atone for the sins of mankind. -Easter Part 1

item.title: A House Divided
item.description: The Son of God declares that blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven, and that a house divided against itself shall fall.

item.title: Christ and the Rich Young Ruler
item.description: Jesus Christ, the Son of God, teaches a rich man how to gain eternal life.

item.title: The Naming of John the Baptist
item.description: John the Baptist is born. Zacharias prophesies of John’s mission to prepare the way for the Son of God.

item.title: Young Jesus Teaches in the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph find Jesus about His father's business, teaching in the temple.

item.title: The Ten Virgins
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the ten virgins.

item.title: The Parable of the Talents
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the talents.

item.title: Ye Have Done it Unto Me
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the sheep and the goats.

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: Mary conceives by the power of the Holy Ghost – Heavenly messengers herald the birth of Jesus in Bethlehem.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind
item.description: On the sabbath day, Jesus heals a man born blind.

item.title: Jesus Teaches that We Must Become as Little Children
item.description: Those who humble themselves as little children are the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

item.title: Suffer the Little Children to Come unto Me
item.description: Jesus invites little children to come unto him, and teaches how to gain eternal life.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Lost Sheep
item.description: Jesus teaches there shall be joy in heaven over one repentant sinner.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Lame Man on the Sabbath
item.description: Jesus performs a miracle by healing an invalid on the sabbath day.

item.title: Seek Ye the Kingdom of God
item.description: Jesus teaches not to lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, but rather to lay up treasures in heaven.

item.title: Follow Me, and I Will Make You Fishers of Men
item.description: Jesus calls Peter, Andrew, James and John to follow Him.

item.title: The Good Shepherd and Other Sheep I Have
item.description: Jesus is the Good Shepherd. He declares that His Father commanded Him to lay down His life, and take it up again.

item.title: Jesus Acclaims John the Baptist / Come Unto Me
item.description: Jesus acclaims John the Baptist; rebukes unbelievers; and declares His burden is light.

item.title: Peter's Revelation to Take the Gospel to the Gentiles
item.description: Peter follows the commandment of the Lord to take the gospel to the Gentiles.

item.title: Forgive 70 Times 7
item.description: Jesus explains how we are to treat our offending brethren.

item.title: The Prodigal Son
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the prodigal son.

item.title: The Kingdom of Heaven
item.description: The parable of the kingdom of heaven teaches about how the just will be separated from the wicked.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Wheat and the Tares
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the wheat and the tares to the disciples.

item.title: I am the Bread of Life
item.description: Jesus teaches He is the bread of life, and how salvation is gained by eating the living bread. Peter testifies that Jesus is the anointed Son of God.

item.title: Whosoever Will Lose His Life for My Sake Shall Find It
item.description: Jesus foretells of His death and resurrection. After He comes in the glory of His Father, every man shall be rewarded according to their works.

item.title: Thou Art the Christ
item.description: Peter testifies that Jesus is the Son of God. Jesus declares that He will give the keys of the kingdom to Peter.

item.title: Render unto Caesar and unto God
item.description: Conspiring men seek to entangle Jesus in His words. Instead, the Savior wittingly teaches them that it is possible to respect civil authority and honor God.

item.title: Peter and John Continue Preaching the Gospel
item.description: Peter and John continue preaching and healing in the name of Jesus Christ, despite the attempts of the Jewish leaders to stop them.

item.title: Peter and John Are Judged
item.description: Peter and John preach in the name of Jesus Christ, and are brought before the leaders of the Jews for questioning.

item.title: Peter Preaches and is Arrested
item.description: Peter and John are arrested for preaching the gospel of Jesus Christ in Jerusalem.

item.title: Peter and John Heal a Man Crippled Since Birth
item.description: With authority from Jesus Christ, Peter and John heal a man crippled since birth.

item.title: Good Tidings of Great Joy: The Birth of Jesus Christ
item.description: Share the good tidings of great joy: that He lives!

item.title: For God So Loved the World
item.description: Give thanks for the Lord Jesus Christ: His life, His atoning sacrifice, and His resurrection.

item.title: Jesus Declares: I Am the Light of the World, the Truth Shall Make You Free
item.description: Jesus declares that He is the light of the world, and the Son of God. Whosoever will embrace His gospel and follow Him can be freed from sin.

item.title: Jesus Cleanses the Temple
item.description: Jesus clears worldly merchandise from the temple courts in order to keep the temple a holy place.

item.title: Jesus Forgives Sins and Heals a Man Stricken with Palsy
item.description: Jesus shows that He has power to both forgive sins and heal physical infirmities.

item.title: Jesus Raises the Daughter of Jairus
item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by raising a young girl from the dead.

item.title: Go and Sin No More
item.description: Jesus teaches about compassion when confronted with a woman accused of adultery.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: Treasures in Heaven
item.description: In His Sermon on the Mount, Jesus teaches His disciples what it means to be a compassionate follower of His Gospel.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Lord's Prayer
item.description: Jesus teaches his disciples the correct manner of prayer and offers the Lord's prayer.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Higher Law
item.description: Jesus teaches His followers essential Christian traits, such as kindness, forgiveness, and love.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Beatitudes
item.description: Jesus describes the characteristics of true Christians.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Woman of Faith
item.description: Jesus heals a woman's illness when she, in faith, touches His clothing.

item.title: Jesus Calls Twelve Apostles to Preach and Bless Others
item.description: Jesus instructs and empowers His original Twelve Apostles.

item.title: Jesus Declares He Is the Messiah
item.description: Jesus announces that He is the Messiah prophesied by Isaiah, but is rejected by His neighbors in Nazareth.

item.title: Jesus Teaches of Being Born Again
item.description: In the darkness of night, Jesus teaches Nicodemus about the necessity of every person being born again.

item.title: Mary, the Mother of Jesus
item.description: Mary was highly favored of God and chosen to be the mother of Jesus Christ. Her humility, devotion, and strength stand as a model for all Christian disciples.

item.title: The Baptism of Jesus
item.description: Jesus seeks out John the Baptist and is baptized in order to fulfill all righteousness.

item.title: Jesus Turns Water into Wine
item.description: Jesus performs a miraculous act of service in one of the first recorded events of His ministry.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Possessed Man
item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by healing a possessed man.

item.title: He is Risen
item.description: Ponder what the Savior means to all humanity—and to you personally. And then share the good news.

item.title: Jesus Is Resurrected
item.description: Peter and John find the empty tomb. Jesus, now resurrected, appears to Mary.

item.title: Jesus Is Laid in a Tomb
item.description: The Savior's body is taken by Joseph of Arimathea to a garden tomb. Angels appear and remove the stone from the front of the tomb. Mary and other women visit the empty tomb.

item.title: Jesus Is Scourged and Crucified
item.description: A band of soldiers strips Jesus of His clothes, scourges Him, and mocks Him. He then carries His cross to Golgotha and is crucified by Roman soldiers.

item.title: Jesus Is Condemned Before Pilate
item.description: Jesus is arraigned and questioned before Pilate, who finds no fault in Him. Yielding to the multitude, Pilate allows Barabbas to be released and Jesus to be crucified.

item.title: Jesus Is Tried by Caiaphas, Peter Denies Knowing Him
item.description: Jesus is tried before Caiaphas and the chief priests. Peter denies knowing Him and weeps bitterly.

item.title: The Savior Suffers in Gethsemane
item.description: Jesus, Peter, James, and John retire to the Garden of Gethsemane. Jesus submits to the Father's will and begins to suffer for the sins and afflictions of mankind. He is then betrayed and arrested.

item.title: Jesus Warns Peter and Offers the Intercessory Prayer
item.description: Jesus admonishes Peter to remain faithful and strengthen his brethren. Peter professes his devotion to Jesus. Jesus foretells Peter's denial and then gives the Intercessory Prayer.

item.title: The Last Supper
item.description: Meeting in an upper room with His disciples, Jesus washes their feet, institutes the sacrament, and commands them to love one another.

item.title: The Lord's Triumphal Entry into Jerusalem
item.description: Jesus rides in triumph into Jerusalem. The multitudes greet Him with shouts of Hosanna to the Son of David.

item.title: Jesus Teaches a Samaritan Woman
item.description: While traveling through Samaria, the Savior teaches a woman at Jacob's Well that He is the "living water."

item.title: Parable of the Good Samaritan
item.description: A depiction of the Savior's parable of the good Samaritan, in which a man is robbed and beaten by thieves, and a Samaritan shows mercy on him.

item.title: Jesus Teaches about the Widow's Mites
item.description: A poor widow contributes her all into the temple treasury. Jesus teaches that her contribution is greater than that of the rich who gave of their abundance.

item.title: The Wise Men Seek Jesus
item.description: The Wise Men present Jesus with gifts—gold, frankincense, and myrrh. After their visit, Mary and Joseph flee to Egypt to protect Jesus from the wicked King Herod, who wishes to kill the child.

item.title: The Christ Child Is Presented at the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph take Jesus to the temple, where the righteous Simeon blesses the baby and rejoices that the Lord let him live to see this day.

item.title: Shepherds Learn of the Birth of Christ
item.description: The angel Gabriel announces the birth of Jesus to the shepherds. The shepherds then visit Mary, Joseph, and the newborn Jesus.

item.title: Mary and Joseph Travel to Bethlehem
item.description: Traveling to their ancestral city of Bethlehem, Mary and Joseph are unable to find a room in an inn. Instead, they find shelter in a place where animals are kept.

item.title: Mary and Elisabeth Rejoice Together
item.description: Mary visits her relative Elisabeth, who in her old age will also soon give birth to a miraculous child. The women rejoice together.

item.title: An Angel Foretells Christ’s Birth to Mary
item.description: The angel Gabriel, sent from the presence of God, announces to the young Mary her future role as the mother of the child Jesus.
